Parameters.description: Parameters for the DISPATCH_PERCEPTIBLE_EVENT operation. Builds and dispatches core:perceptible_event.

perception_type.description: Category of perceptible event to emit.

actor_description.description: First-person description delivered to the actor (e.g., 'I do a handstand'). When provided, the actor receives this message without sensory filtering - they always know what they're doing.

target_description.description: Target-perspective description delivered to the target (e.g., '{context.actorName} caresses my cheek gently.'). When provided, the target receives this message. Sensory filtering still applies. Note: Only provide if target is an entity with a perception log component - a warning is emitted if target lacks this component.

alternate_descriptions.description: Alternative event descriptions for different sensory contexts

auditory.description: Description when perceived through hearing (sounds, speech)

tactile.description: Description when perceived through touch (vibrations, contact)

limited.description: Fallback description when primary and specific senses unavailable

sense_aware.description: When true (default), applies sense-based filtering. When false, all recipients receive the event regardless of sensory state. Accepts literal boolean or placeholder string that resolves to boolean at runtime.
